snippet: In a Wall Street universe full of marquee stocks, lesser known entities are the stars of the rally so far this year.
abstract: Surge in so-called small-cap stocks, or companies whose total share value is $3 billion or less, indicates that investor appetite for risk and confidence in the economy is growing; lesser known entities have been the surprise stars of a 2012 stock rally in a Wall Street universe populated by marquee name stocks.

headline.main: Small-Cap Stocks Surge Ahead of the Big Names
headline.print_headline: Small-Cap Stocks Surge Ahead of the Big Names

snippet: How a mobile phone can add some intensity to Valentine's Day celebrations.
abstract: How a mobile phone can add some intensity to Valentine's Day celebrations.

headline.main: App Smart Extra: Downloading Some Romance

snippet: Angry Birds, the popular mobile game that challenges players to fling birds at elaborate structures, has migrated to Facebook. Its maker is adding features that are important to its business plans, like coupons for game "power-ups" that accompany ...
abstract: Angry Birds, the popular mobile game that challenges players to fling birds at elaborate structures, has migrated to Facebook. Its maker is adding features that are important to its business plans, like coupons for game "power-ups" that accompany stuffed toys.

headline.main: Angry Birds Migrates to Facebook and Toy Stores

snippet: On Monday, Apple reached new heights with its shares closing at $502.60, up $9.18, or 1.86 percent. It was the first time Apple's share price had passed $500.
abstract: On Monday, Apple reached new heights with its shares closing at $502.60, up $9.18, or 1.86 percent. It was the first time Apple's share price had passed $500.

headline.main: Apple Shares Close Above $500, Breaking More Records

snippet: The reputations of Bank of America, Berkshire Hathaway, Wells Fargo, JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs all fell significantly in this year's Harris Interactive survey.
abstract: The reputations of Bank of America, Berkshire Hathaway, Wells Fargo, JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs all fell significantly in this year's Harris Interactive survey.

snippet: On Monday, after nearly 200 performances, the monologuist Mike Daisey was to release a theatrical transcript of his latest one-man show, "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," through his Web site.
abstract: On Monday, after nearly 200 performances, the monologuist Mike Daisey was to release a theatrical transcript of his latest one-man show, "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," through his Web site.

snippet: The Justice Department approval came hours after the European Union imposed no conditions on the acquisition.
abstract: American and European regulators approve Google's $12.5 billion acquisition of cellphone maker Motorola Mobility, paving the way for the search giant to compete directly with Apple in the smartphone industry.

headline.main: Google Deal for Motorola Mobility Gets Clearance
headline.print_headline: Google Deal for Motorola Mobility Gets Clearance

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and DAVID STREITFELD

snippet: Apple said the audit would look at conditions at Chinese sites where iPhones and other products are made. Some labor groups lauded the move, but others were skeptical.
abstract: Apple said the audit would look at conditions at Chinese sites where iPhones and other products are made. Some labor groups lauded the move, but others were skeptical.

headline.main: Apple Asks Outside Group to Inspect Factories
headline.print_headline: Apple In Shift, Pushes An Audit Of Sites In China

byline.original: By CHARLES DUHIGG and NICK WINGFIELD

snippet: Greek lawmakers backed large cuts in wages, pensions and jobs in exchange for a 130 billion euro, or $171 billion, rescue by the European Union and the International Monetary Fund.
abstract: Stocks rise after the Greek Parliament approves measures needed to qualify for a bailout and avoid a default; Apple shares close above $500 for the first time, leading the Nasdaq to its highest close in more than 11 years to 2,931.39.

headline.main: Shares Rise After Greece Acts to Qualify for Bailout
headline.print_headline: Shares Rise After Greece Acts to Qualify for Bailout

snippet: A school has been taking young children on field trips that provide an often missing context for some of their lessons.

headline.main: A Field Trip to a Strange New Place: Second Grade Visits the Parking Garage
headline.print_headline: A Field Trip to a Strange New Place: Second Grade Visits the Parking Garage
